showed.text: Lemma 4.27. The treedepth $t$ strictly upper bounds the pathwidth $p$. We have $p \le t$.

showed.text: The results of [23] imply that each graph class of bounded path-width has bounded linear NLC-width and that each graph class of bounded tree-width has bounded NLCT-width.

showed.text: Theorem 44. For every graph $G$, the pathwidth of $G$ is at most the bandwidth of $G$, ... Proof. Let $f \colon V\to \{1,\dots,n\}$ be a linear ordering of $G$ with bandwidth $k$. Then $(X_1,\dots,X_{n-k})$ with $X_i=\{f^{-1}(i), f^{-1}(i+1), \dots, f^{-1}(i+k)\}$ is a path decomposition of $G$ with pathwidth $k$. ...
Theorem 45. For every graph $G$, the pathwidth of $G$ is at most the topological band-width of $G$.
Theorem 47. For every graph $G$, the pathwidth of $G$ is at most the cutwidth of $G$.

showed.text: After removal of $k$ vertices the remaining class has a bounded width $w$. So by including the removed vertices in every bag, we can achieve decomposition of width $w+k$
After removal of $k$ vertices the remaining class has a bounded width $w$. So by including the removed vertices in every bag, we can achieve decomposition of width $w+k$

displayed_definition: Same as treewidth but restricted to have a tree decomposition that is a path.
